universe."[ 2] In that desire to vindicate comes an equal temptation to shape the events favorably, a desire that Donald Rumsfeld seems not to have escaped, as Fred Kaplan points out at Slate: Many autobiographies exhibit[ the tendency to self-aggrandizement] to some extent.
